Belgium:
Maurice of Nassau lays siege to Sluis.
Negotiations for the surrender of Ostend begin.
Siege of Ostend concludes.
Chile: A fort established in 1602 at the ruins of Valdivia is abandoned.
China: The grand secretary Gu Xiancheng reopened the Donglin Academy in Wuxi, establishing the Donglin movement.
Indinesia: A second English East India Company voyage commanded by Sir Henry Middleton reaches Ternate, Tidore, Ambon and Banda. Fierce VOC hostility is encountered in Banda thus beginning Anglo-Dutch competition for access to spices
Russia: False Dmitriy I, a man claiming to be the deceased Dmitriy Ivanovich, invaded Russia.
Spain: Anglo-Spanish War (1598): The war ended and a lot of people died.
Taiwan: Sino-Dutch conflicts: Dutch envoy Wijbrand van Waerwijck and his army are ordered to occupy Penghu (Pescadores) in order to open trade with China
